label: Colombia Records
overview: Dangerously in Love is Beyoncé's debut studio album. This album marked a shift in her career, as she began to move away from Destiny's Child and establish herself as a solo artist. Beyoncé also worked to establish herself as more than just as singer on this album, as she is credited as a co-writer, co-producer, and executive producer. This album contains a variety of mid-tempo and ballad songs that fit into the R&B and soul genre. Though Beyoncé had a hard time gaining support from record executives for this album, it became a huge success, commercially and critically. This is the album that set Beyoncé on the path to becoming the dominating force in the music industry that she is today.

extras.extra1: Dangerously in Love debuted as number one on the US Billdobard 200 chart
extras.extra2: As of June 2016, Dangerously In Love is Beyoncé's best selling album.
extras.extra3: At the 46th Annual Grammy Awards in 2004, Beyoncé won 5 awards for  Dangerously in Love. She won Best Female R&B Vocal Performance, Best R&B Vocal Performance by a Duo or a Group with Vocals, Best R&B Song, Best Contemporary R&B Album, and Best Rap/Sung Collaboration.
extras.extra4: Dangerously in Love is 4x Platinum certified in the United States, and has sold over 5,000,000 units in the United States alone.
